intro: Quercus saei, commonly known as the Sardinian oak, is a deciduous tree native to the island of Sardinia. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, featuring a broad, rounded canopy and deeply lobed leaves. Its acorns are an important food source for various wildlife species. The bark is thick and fissured, providing a distinctive appearance and offering some protection against pests and diseases.
